org.gwtunite.client.net
Class WebServerRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      org.gwtunite.client.net.WebServerRequest

public final class WebServerRequest
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

A Request made to the Web server.

WebServerRequest holds information about the incoming request, such as its URI, method and any data sent along with it.

An instance of this object will be sent to any WebServerEventHandler when the onConnection method is called.

The full body of the HTTP request as a String.

Returns:
The full body as test or NULL if there is no body or it is binary

name - The name of the body item to test for
Returns:
true if a body item with the given name exists in this request

the names of all items posted in the Body of this request

Retrieves a specific POSTed Body item from this request

Parameters:
name - The name of the body item to be retrieved
Returns:
A list of values for the body item or null if the body item does not exist in this request

getConnection

public WebServerConnection getConnection()
Retrieves the WebServerConnection this request was sent through

Returns:
the connection this request was sent through

getUploadedFiles

public File getUploadedFiles()
Retrieves the files uploaded and sent with this request

The returned File object represents a virtual directory which points to the uploaded files. Access the individual files using File.listFiles().

The name of the file is the filename the user selected when uploading.

Request headers for these files are available through the file metadata

Returns:
A File object representing a virtual directory holding the uploaded files

getHost

public java.lang.String getHost()
The value of the Host header sent with this request. As opposed to the getUri() method, this will give you the host name the request was made to, which can be used for among other things redirects. This may contain the port of the request, i.e. 'foo.bar:80'.

Returns:
the value of the Host header sent with this request

getRemoteIP

public java.lang.String getRemoteIP()
The IP address of the client that sent this request.

Note: This currently only gives you the IP address of the proxy.

Returns:
the IP address of the client that sent this request

getItem

public java.lang.String[] getItem(java.lang.String name)
Get the value of a request item.

This method gets the values of items sent in a query string (typically through GET requests) or in the body of the request (typically through POST requests). Each item may occur multiple times with different values, both in the query string and the body.

Parameters:
name - Name of the request item to retrieve
Returns:
An Array of values for the given request item, or null if there are no values for the given request item.

getMethod

public java.lang.String getMethod()
Retrieves the method of this request, one of GET, POST, PUT or DELETE.

Returns:
The HTTP method of this request

getProtocol

public java.lang.String getProtocol()
The protocol this request was made over.

This is either 'http' or 'https'. Use it to construct links and redirects and preserve the correct security qualifications of the URIs.

Returns:
the protocol that this request was made over.

getUri

public java.lang.String getUri()
The Uniform Resource Identifier this request was made to.

Relative URI the request is made out to, starting with '/' and the name of the service, e.g. http://work.john.operaunite.com/wiki/add becomes '/wiki/add'.

Returns:
The URI this request was made to

getSession

public WebServerSession getSession()
Returns the user session connected to this request. WARNING: This method is NOT included on the public OperaUnite API and is only included here for compatibility. Be warned that it could very well change in future!

Returns:
The WebServerSession for the user

setUri

public void setUri(java.lang.String uri)
            throws MalformedURIException
Set the Uniform Resource Identifier this request was made to.

Setting the URI is used when the request should be redispatched. See the WebServerResponse.closeAndRedispatch() method.

Parameters:
uri - The URI to set
Throws:
MalformedURIException - if an invalid URI is set or if the URI points to a different service than the one the request was issued from.
